text: have you won today I'm making Bonnie or
sizzling lipstick and egg on a hot plate
this is quite a popular breakfast dish
in central and southern Vietnam at the
Barnett place the hot plates are
prepared right at the doorstep on the
extremely hot couch shaped hot plates
they place a light but pink piece of
stick a meat patty a sunny-side up egg
and then some butter Pat a meatball and
some spring onion and helps to garnish
it is then served with some fresh
veggies like tomatoes cucumbers and
lettuce and a crispy Vietnamese forget
the hot plate should still be sizzling
when being served and therefore they
call it Bonaire because ball means beef
and nee means to dodge meaning you
should stand away from it to avoid the
splashing with quite a few items on the
hot plate this is quite a filling and
satisfying preference as you can prepare
for your family on weekends so let's see
whether we can make it at home let's
begin to make the meatballs you're going
to need 400 gram or 1 point 1 power of
mince pork we're going to season with a
tablespoon of minced shallots a
tablespoon of minced garlic a teaspoon
of stock powder half a teaspoon of
cracked pepper and two tablespoons of
fish sauce mix well and set aside for
about 15 minutes and then divide them
into ten equal portions and roll each
portion into a nice ball after that
place all the meatballs on a deep plate
and then steamed for about 15 to 20
minutes until they are cooked through
when you poke a chopstick and don't see
any pink water running out it means they
are cooked
if you want to add some caramelized
onions into your banana - you can also
do it by cut the onion into slices and
then cook in a pan with some oil and a
teaspoon of sugar stir well and cook on
medium heat for about 30 minutes until
the onion slices turn quite golden and
become caramelized like this for each
portion of the top plate you're going to
need one large piece of beef cut against
the grain to the thickness of around
1/10 of an inch
seasoned with salt and pepper and rub
some minced garlic on both sides of the
beef slice also add some sesame oil and
oyster sauce to give it a nice fragrance
give it a little tap and set aside for
about 10 to 15 minutes place a hot plate
on the stove over medium-high heat when
it's knightly hot and smoky add some oil
carefully use kitchen gloves to chill
the hot plate
distributing the or evenly into the hot
plate seekers the beef steak depending
on the thickness fry for about 30 to 60
seconds and then flip it over push to
one side crack an egg and drop into the
empty space add a cube or pop little
patty in some meatball and some spring
onion and cilantro on top
don't forget some sweet caramelized
onion at the Cana - mmm what a god just
plate and it's still sizzling when you
serve it on the table
serve with a plate of lettuce cucumber
and tomato slices at the sides to serve
I like to squeeze some hot sauce and soy
sauce or work tear a piece of that
